result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ty M Leonard

records.addlTxt: Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI), Filed.

Defendant Ty M Leonard in court, in custody.  Attorney Imran Kurter in court for Ty M Leonard.  Assistant District Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant waived constitutional rights, changed plea to Guilty and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Counts ! & 3 dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  Parties request a PSI without recommendation.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Br 45.  mn
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for today's date canceled. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 9/23/22 at 9:30 am at request of defense.

Defendant Ty M Leonard in court with Attorney Imran Kurter; both appear by video.  Defendant Ty M Leonard in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with A.L.S and the Wauwatosa Library
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $75,000.00 .  If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list, monitoring is 24 hour curfew.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
No contact with any children under the age of 15.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES:  
Defendant Ty M Leonard in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Ty M Leonard in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
